summary: Email correspondence between a DOJ OIG Senior Special Agent and an Associate Warden regarding scheduling an interview for an investigation into the August 10, 2019 incident at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The Associate Warden was previously at MCC New York and had been transferred to FCC Forrest City, Arkansas.

persons.name: Matulewicz
persons.role: Senior Special Agent, U.S. Department of Justice OIG Boston Area Office
persons.context: The DOJ OIG investigator who is reaching out to schedule an interview with the Associate Warden regarding the August 10, 2019 incident at MCC New York.

persons.name: Associate Warden FCC Forrest City
persons.context: The recipient of the interview request; a Bureau of Prisons official who was formerly at MCC New York and is believed to have gathered documentation related to the August 10, 2019 incident.

connections.description: Matulewicz, a DOJ OIG agent, is requesting an interview with the Associate Warden as part of an official investigation.

events.title: Incident at MCC New York
events.description: An incident occurred at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York City. The DOJ OIG is investigating this incident and seeks documentation gathered by the Associate Warden immediately following it.

events.title: Scheduled OIG Interview
events.description: A telephone interview is scheduled between DOJ OIG Senior Special Agent Matulewicz and the Associate Warden.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York City)
FCC Forrest City, AR (Federal Correctional Complex, 1301 Dale Bumpers, Forrest City, AR 72335)
Boston Area Office (U.S. Department of Justice OIG)
keyFacts: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG) is conducting an investigation related to an incident that occurred at MCC New York on August 10, 2019.

A key person of interest is an Associate Warden who was at MCC New York at the time of the incident and gathered documentation immediately following it, but has since been transferred to FCC Forrest City, Arkansas.
The correspondence details the logistical planning for a voluntary interview, including the provision of a standard OIG interview form.
The incident date (August 10, 2019) coincides with the date Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his MCC New York cell.
